00028 C
00029 C
00030 C user include file for MPI programs, with no dependencies 
00031 C
00032 C It really isn't possible to make a perfect include file that can
00033 C be used by both F77 and F90 compilers, but this is close.  We've removed
00034 C continuation lines (allows free form input in F90); systems whose
00035 C Fortran compilers support ! instead of just C or * for comments can
00036 C globally replace a C in the first column with !; the resulting file
00037 C should work for both Fortran 77 and Fortran 90.
00038 C
00039 C If your Fortran compiler supports ! for comments, you can run this 
00040 C through sed with
00041 C     sed -e 's/^C/\!/g'
00042 C
00043 C return codes

00045       INTEGER MPI_ERR_TAG,MPI_ERR_COMM,MPI_ERR_RANK,MPI_ERR_ROOT

00100       INTEGER MPI_IDENT, MPI_CONGRUENT, MPI_SIMILAR, MPI_UNEQUAL
00101       PARAMETER (MPI_IDENT=0, MPI_CONGRUENT=1, MPI_SIMILAR=2)
00102       PARAMETER (MPI_UNEQUAL=3)
00103 C
00104 C     MPI_BOTTOM needs to be a known address; here we put it at the
00105 C     beginning of the common block.  The point-to-point and collective
00106 C     routines know about MPI_BOTTOM, but MPI_TYPE_STRUCT as yet does not.
00107 C
00108 C     The types MPI_INTEGER1,2,4 and MPI_REAL4,8 are OPTIONAL.
00109 C     Their values are zero if they are not available.  Note that
00110 C     using these reduces the portability of code (though may enhance
00111 C     portability between Crays and other systems)
00112 C
00113       INTEGER MPI_TAG_UB, MPI_HOST, MPI_IO
00114       INTEGER MPI_BOTTOM
00115       INTEGER MPI_INTEGER, MPI_REAL, MPI_DOUBLE_PRECISION 
00116       INTEGER MPI_COMPLEX, MPI_DOUBLE_COMPLEX,MPI_LOGICAL
00117       INTEGER MPI_CHARACTER, MPI_BYTE, MPI_2INTEGER, MPI_2REAL
00118       INTEGER MPI_2DOUBLE_PRECISION, MPI_2COMPLEX, MPI_2DOUBLE_COMPLEX
00119       INTEGER MPI_INTEGER1, MPI_INTEGER2, MPI_INTEGER4
00120       INTEGER MPI_REAL4, MPI_REAL8, MPI_UB, MPI_LB
00121       INTEGER MPI_PACKED, MPI_WTIME_IS_GLOBAL
00122       INTEGER MPI_COMM_WORLD, MPI_COMM_SELF, MPI_GROUP_EMPTY
00123       INTEGER MPI_SUM, MPI_MAX, MPI_MIN, MPI_PROD, MPI_LAND, MPI_BAND

00164 C
00165 C     All other MPI routines are subroutines
00166 C     This may cause some Fortran compilers to complain about defined and
00167 C     not used.  Such compilers should be improved.
00168 C
00169       DOUBLE PRECISION MPI_WTIME, MPI_WTICK
00170       EXTERNAL MPI_WTIME, MPI_WTICK
00171 C
00172 C     The attribute copy/delete subroutines are symbols that can be passed
00173 C     to MPI routines
00174 C
00175       EXTERNAL MPI_NULL_COPY_FN, MPI_NULL_DELETE_FN, MPI_DUP_FN
